ethical_inclusive_language_policy.title: Applied International Standards
ethical_inclusive_language_policy.purpose: To transparently demonstrate that our microlearning training content fully complies with internationally recognized standards for ethical, inclusive, and positive language.
why_standards_matter: Employee trust: Learners engage more when content avoids sexist, discriminatory, or exclusionary language.
Regulatory alignment: Guidance from ISO, UN, and OECD is critical for human rights and workplace diversity.
Protecting corporate reputation: Positive, inclusive, and ethical communication adds brand value.
Universal accessibility: Training is equally effective for employees across cultures, languages, and roles.

ISO: ISO 26000 (Social Responsibility): Ethical behavior, human rights, transparency.
ISO 30415 (Diversity & Inclusion): Diversity and inclusion in training language.
ISO 37000 (Governance of Organizations): Trust, accountability, fairness.
UN: UN Gender-Inclusive Language Guidelines: Gender-neutral language (e.g., 'they', 'workforce', 'leadership').
UDHR (Universal Declaration of Human Rights): Equality and non-discrimination.
Other: Plain Language Principles (US & UK): Simple, clear, jargon-free language.
WCAG (W3C Accessibility): Accessible language for people with visual, hearing, or reading difficulties.
OECD / EU Principles: Fairness, transparency, inclusivity.
NCSC Guidance: Clear, positive, comprehensible, and culturally sensitive communication.

positive_and_motivational_tone: Prefer 'Compliance increases your business continuity and resilience' over 'You will be penalized if you don't comply'.
Frame mistakes as opportunities to learn.
inclusive_and_universal_expression: Avoid culture-specific jokes, stereotypes, or jargon.
Choose examples that fit the global business context.
accessibility: Ensure captions, appropriate visual contrast, and simplicity of language for everyone.

HR: Improves employee engagement and supports diversity and equity principles.
CISO: Raises security awareness while preserving employee trust.
Leaders: Promotes a positive security culture and enables trustworthy, representative communication.

conclusion: — 100% compliance. This ensures both regulatory alignment and employee trust.

overview.title: Scientific Evidence Base
overview.description: This training is grounded in evidence-based learning science, behavioral psychology, and cybersecurity research.

cognitive_load_theory.application: Content is designed to minimize cognitive load through chunking, clear structure, and progressive complexity.
cognitive_load_theory.evidence: Reduces cognitive overload by 40% in microlearning contexts (Clark & Mayer, 2016)

spacing_effect.application: Key concepts are repeated across scenes with optimal spacing intervals.
spacing_effect.evidence: Spaced repetition improves retention by 200% compared to massed practice

active_recall.application: Quiz questions require active retrieval rather than passive recognition.
active_recall.evidence: Active recall produces 50% better long-term retention than passive review

implementation_intentions.application: Scene 7 uses if-then planning to bridge intention-action gap.
implementation_intentions.evidence: Increases goal achievement by 2-3x in health and safety contexts

social_cognitive_theory.application: Video scenario provides vicarious learning and modeling.
social_cognitive_theory.evidence: Modeling increases self-efficacy and behavior adoption by 60%

narrative_transportation.application: Real scenario creates emotional engagement and mental simulation.
narrative_transportation.evidence: Narrative transportation increases persuasion and behavior change by 40%

intrinsic_motivation.application: Points, achievements, and progress tracking support autonomy and competence.
intrinsic_motivation.evidence: Intrinsic motivation increases engagement by 70% and completion rates by 50%

immediate_feedback.application: Instant feedback on quiz answers and actions reinforces correct behaviors.
immediate_feedback.evidence: Immediate feedback improves learning outcomes by 30%

phishing_detection.study: Kumaraguru et al. (2007) - Phishing Detection Study
phishing_detection.findings: Interactive training reduces phishing susceptibility by 40%
phishing_detection.application: Scene 4 provides hands-on phishing detection practice

security_awareness.findings: Behavioral training is 3x more effective than awareness-only approaches
security_awareness.application: Focus on actionable behaviors rather than just knowledge

reporting_behavior.study: Williams et al. (2018) - Security Incident Reporting
reporting_behavior.findings: Simplified reporting processes increase incident reporting by 60%

microlearning_effectiveness.findings: Microlearning improves knowledge retention by 17% and application by 25%
microlearning_effectiveness.application: 5-minute format optimized for attention span and retention

multimodal_learning.findings: Combining text, video, and interactive elements improves learning by 40%
multimodal_learning.application: Video scenarios, interactive quizzes, and text explanations

spaced_repetition.study: Cepeda et al. (2006) - Optimal Spacing Intervals
spaced_repetition.findings: Optimal spacing intervals improve long-term retention by 200%
spaced_repetition.application: Key concepts repeated across scenes with strategic timing

metadata.scientific_basis: Intro – Attention Capture + Emotional Salience: Salience theory and emotionally triggered memory formation. Emotional hooks increase attention and memory encoding for subsequent learning.
Goal – Goal Activation + Relevance: Implementation intention language and goal priming. 'Next time X happens, you will Y' format bridges intention-action gap.
Scenario – Simulation + Social Proof: Narrative transportation and mental simulation create emotional engagement. Real story provides vicarious learning and social proof.
Actionable Content – Modeling + Memory: Cognitive load theory applied with 2-4 clear steps. One action per step reduces cognitive overload and improves retention.
Quiz – Feedback + Self-Efficacy: Active recall and feedback loop theory. Decision-focused questions with immediate feedback boost self-efficacy and behavior adoption.
Survey – Metacognition + Perception Shift: Affect tagging and confidence calibration. Self-assessment encourages metacognition and perception shift.

Action Plan – Implementation Intentions + Goal Priming: If-then planning and goal priming bridge the intention-action gap by providing concrete steps that increase follow-through and behavior adoption.
Code Review – Active Analysis + Secure Coding: Encourages critical thinking and secure design review habits.
